application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: (T1) Robinia (R.pseudoacacia 'Frisia')- reduce crown by 30% (3m) to suitable growth points- reduce lateral branches to match, shape, balance and tidy - remove all deadwood branchesRETAINED HEIGHT - 12mRETAINED SPREAD - 7m(T2) Cherry (Prunus)- reduce crown by 25% to suitable growth points- thin crown removing selected inner stems to allow more light through canopyRETAINED HEIGHT - 4mRETAINED SPREAD - 3m(T3) Cherry (Prunus)- reduce crown by 25% to suitable growth points- thin crown by 15% to allow more light through canopyRETAINED HEIGHT - 2.5mmRETAINED SPREAD - 3m(T4) Box Elder (Acer negundo) 2x main stems 1x overhanging boundary - reduce crown by 30% (2m) to suitable growth pointsRETAINED HEIGHT - 3mRETAINED SPREAD - 2.5m(T5) Pittosporum - 3x stems at low break- remove entirely 2x right hand stems to main break union- reduce remaining crown by 40% (3m) to rounded natural canopy lineRETAINED HEIGHT - 3.5mmRETAINED SPREAD - 3m(T6) Sycamore (Acer pseudoplatanus)- remove large overhanging limb to previous cut stems inside neighbours' garden using rigging equipment to safely lower branch to ground level to minimise potential damage to greenhouse- reduce length of smaller branch to inside boundary lineOVERHANGING BRANCHES ONLY
